title: Teen accidentally shoots self at Hoover apartment, blames it on fake drive-by assailant
content:
Hoover police report a 15-year-old accidentally shot himself Friday evening - and tried to pass the blame at first.
At approximately 7:15 p.m., the Hoover 911 Center got a call about a shooting at the Abbey at Wisteria Creek Apartments. Two males, ages 15 and 17, said they were standing in front of an apartment when a car drove by and shot at them.
The 15-year-old had a gunshot wound in his leg, said Hoover Police Department spokesman Capt. Gregg Rector. He was transported to Children's Hospital.
Authorities say the injury does not appear life-threatening.
Rector said the teen later admitted that he accidentally shot himself. The admission came about during further questioning at the hospital.
This is the second 15-year-old in the region to accidentally shoot himself within two weeks. A teen and two others in Birmingham were "horse playing" with a gun the evening of Sept. 21. The 15-year-old was shot in the chest but survived.
